info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 10 at 1:19PM PDT until August 17 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Potential for high heat risk across the region. High temperatures reaching up to 112 degrees and overnight lows as warm as 69 degrees. Multiple days of heat increases the heat risk. * WHERE...Shasta, Scott and Klamath River Valleys. The warmest temperatures will be in the Klamath River Valley. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Hazardous heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those without air conditioning, or those working or participating in outdoor activities without adequate hydration. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If thunderstorms do form, then cloud cover will impact temperatures throughout the event. The cloud cover would reduce high temperatures and perhaps keep temperatures warmer than anticipated overnight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
